oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Toll Gate Building at 3307 Charlotte Avenue, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1957, Vol. 1 p. 10
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the old toll gate log cabin at 3307 Charlotte Avenue before it was torn down, March 1957. Built in the 1850s, the log structure belonged to the Carter family. It was eventually torn down in March of 1957 after being labeled "a hazard to the public" by the city building inspector. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1957. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
